decks.notes: The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using Fires of Invention and controlling the game with spells like Shatter the Sky and Teferi, Time Raveler. Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast is used to cheat out powerful creatures like Agent of Treachery, while Shark Typhoon can create a large flying threat. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a companion for additional value with its blink effect. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through card advantage and strong control elements.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and planeswalkers. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building card advantage and eventually winning the game with powerful threats like Shark Typhoon. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a companion that allows for additional value by flickering permanents. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure a smooth game plan and consistency in casting the powerful spells. The key strategy is to outlast the opponent by managing resources effectively and out-valuing them in the late game.

This aggressive deck focuses on using cycling cards to quickly draw through the deck, utilizing cards like Zenith Flare to deal damage based on the number of cards cycled. It also includes cards like Improbable Alliance and Valiant Rescuer to keep up the pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to cycle through cards efficiently while putting pressure on the opponent with a combination of small creatures and direct damage spells. Using Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for recurring small creatures from the graveyard to maintain board presence.

The deck focuses on utilizing a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By using its powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to disrupt the opponent's strategy, along with board wipes like Shatter the Sky and cards like Absorb to protect itself, the deck aims to stall the game until it can establish a win condition. Cards like Dream Trawler and Shark Typhoon provide a strong finisher to close out the game once the opponent has been neutralized.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize adventure creatures and the Lucky Clover enchantment to generate value and tempo advantage. By playing adventure creatures like Brazen Borrower and Beanstalk Giant, the deck leverages the card advantage provided by Edgewall Innkeeper and Lucky Clover to maintain pressure on the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Escape to the Wilds for additional ramp and card advantage to outpace the opponent and close out the game quickly through aggressive plays and efficient resource management.

This deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent quickly and efficiently with low-cost creatures and burn spells. The goal is to attack aggressively, using cards like Fervent Champion and Anax, Hardened in the Forge to deal damage quickly. The inclusion of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion adds an additional source of damage output. The deck also includes a mix of burn spells like Shock and Skewer the Critics to clear blockers and finish off opponents. Castle Embereth provides extra damage output, while Light Up the Stage helps refill your hand for continued aggression.

The deck focuses on utilizing the odd mana cost companion, Obosh, the Preypiercer, to enhance the damage output of aggressive red creatures. By including only odd mana cost cards in the deck, the player can take advantage of Obosh's ability to deal extra damage with each odd-costed creature or spell. With a mix of fast, low cost creatures and burn spells, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and finish the game before they can stabilize.

The deck revolves around using low-cost creatures with powerful enchantments and protection spells to quickly build up a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for consistent access to key cards like Alseid of Life's Bounty and Karametra's Blessing. By combining evasion, protection, and buff spells, the deck aims to create resilient and difficult-to-remove threats that can end the game swiftly.

The main idea of this deck is to utilize the companion Gyruda, Doom of Depths to create a powerful combo strategy. By running multiple copies of Gyruda and Spark Double, the deck aims to consistently trigger Gyruda's ability to put a non-legendary creature with an even cmc from the deck onto the battlefield, providing a strong board presence and advantage. Supporting cards like Thassa, Deep-Dwelling and Luminous Broodmoth help to further enhance the synergy within the deck, maximizing the potential for explosive plays and overwhelming the opponent.

Utilize the Gyruda companion card to build a combo deck centered around copying and bouncing creatures like Dream Trawler and Thassa, Deep-Dwelling to generate card advantage and control the board. Accelerate your mana base with ramp spells like Growth Spiral and Migration Path to support the powerful late-game plays of End-Raze Forerunners and Luminous Broodmoth. Use Charming Prince and Elite Guardmage to gain life and draw cards, while protecting your key combo pieces. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of value and efficient threats.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils, along with board wipes like Shatter the Sky. The key strategy is to ramp up mana quickly with Fires of Invention and Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast, allowing you to cast big spells like Agent of Treachery and Elspeth Conquers Death. The addition of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion adds additional value by flickering permanents for extra card advantage and board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively play creatures like Gruul Spellbreaker, Zhur-Taa Goblin, and Pelt Collector early on, then use powerful finishers like Embercleave and Skarrgan Hellkite to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Questing Beast and Grumgully, the Generous adds additional aggressive threats, while cards like Collision / Colossus and Domri's Ambush provide removal and combat tricks. The deck also includes ramp in Paradise Druid and Vivien, Monsters' Advocate to help cast higher cost creatures like Skarrgan Hellkite.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively control the board through a combination of counterspells and removal while also taking advantage of flash creatures for unexpected plays. The deck includes a mix of creatures with flash and disruptive abilities, such as Sea-Dasher Octopus and Dirge Bat, along with cards like Cunning Nightbonder to reduce the cost of your spells. By maintaining a balance of aggression and control, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent while keeping them off balance with its unexpected plays.

This deck focuses on aggressive play, utilizing sacrifice synergies and small creatures to deal consistent damage to the opponent. By sacrificing creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Serrated Scorpion, along with using cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Mayhem Devil, the deck aims to control the board and chip away at the opponent's life total. Cards like Judith, the Scourge Diva and Anax, Hardened in the Forge provide additional damage and value, while Bastion of Remembrance offers a drain effect to close out games. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently.

The deck focuses on utilizing low cost aggressive creatures alongside powerful spells to deal a high amount of damage quickly to the opponent. The presence of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion amplifies the damage output, while cards like Phoenix of Ash and Anax, Hardened in the Forge provide consistent threats on the battlefield. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless assault, leveraging the synergy between the creatures and burn spells to secure a victory before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on controlling the board through counterspells, removal, and sweepers while generating card advantage and value through card draw and blink effects. It aims to outvalue the opponent by protecting its key threats and disrupting the opponent's game plan. The deck utilizes permanents that generate additional value when blinked by Yorion, Sky Nomad, allowing for repetitive triggers and maintaining card advantage. The win conditions include resolving powerful threats like Dream Trawler or creating an army of Shark tokens with Shark Typhoon to close out the game.
